intro: Crepidomanes inopinatum var. tamonii, commonly known as the Tamonii rockrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. It is native to rocky and arid environments in southern Europe and parts of North Africa. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in xeriscaping and rock gardens.
